result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 09-01-2016 at 10:30am.
**09-01-16/Rest. Hearing, Court ordered restitution amount set at ZERO.

Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 11-08-16 or civil judgment. Court WAIVES all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges due to the previous forfeiture and entry of a civil judgment of the two signature bonds.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Edwards

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for restitution hearing.  Joint stipulation for restitution amount.  Court ordered restition amount set at ZERO.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Nicholas Edwards in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statement made by Sherine E. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests case be calendared for restitution hearing. Court grants defense request. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 10 days time served. STRAIGHT TIME. 

- Cout WAIVES all MANDATORY costs, assessments and surcharges due to the previous forfiture and entry of a civil judgment of the two signiture bonds. 
- Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge, due by 11/08/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

RECEIVED & FILED: Pretrial Incarceration Credit. 

Case adjourned for restitution hearing on 09/01/2016 at 10:30 am, Branch 31.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Nicholas Edwards in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas Edwards
Current: 7606 W Appleton Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 08-04-2016)
Prior: 5068 North 107th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($350.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 350.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with the address listed on the criminal complaint

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Defendant Nicholas Edwards in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Oral No Contact Order with: 6136 West Medford Avenue.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  
Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Branch 21.

Defendant Nicholas Edwards in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Nicholas Edwards in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.     Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  .

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Case adjourned for pretrial conference in Reserve Branch 21.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
